sentences.sContent: Compromise is an inevitable part of marriage.
sentences.sCn: 妥协是婚姻生活中必不可少的。

sentences.sContent: To stop the argument they decided on a compromise.
sentences.sCn: 为停止争吵，他们决定作出妥协。

sentences.sContent: If moderates fail to reach a compromise , the extremists will dominate the agenda.
sentences.sCn: 如果温和派不能达成妥协，激进派就会主宰议事日程。

remMethod.val: com + promise(保证) → 相互保证 → 妥协， 折中

trans.tranOther: an agreement that is achieved after everyone involved accepts less than what they wanted at first, or the act of making this agreement
